Well, I couldn't find the ad I was looking for, but this one will do:  For any who don't know, the black gun is an AR-15 platform rifle. That gun uses an intermediate powered round like the .223. The gun is semi-auto and has never been used by any military for combat purposes. The one specifically pictured is chambered in .22LR, suitable for hunting squirrels and rabbits and not much else. The gun below it is an M-1 Garand battle rifle. That gun uses the 30–06 round, which is a common high powered hunting round. The M-1 was the standard issue battle rifle for the US military during WW2 and during the Korean War. It is also semi-auto and has a much longer range than the AR. So to recap: the ad says that the intermediate powered, never-been-military-issued rifle is a weapon of war too high powered for civilians. And the the high powered, military-issued-in-2-wars rifle is ok for civilian use. Just goes to show that groups like Everytown and Moms Demand Action base all their claims and demands on the appearance of a gun rather than its actual performance. Also shows just how truly ignorant those groups are about the one thing they stand against. Ads similar to the one above always make me laugh. EDIT 10/24/20: So there have been several comments questioning whether or not this ad is real. Understandable. It's difficult to believe anyone can be that ignorant. Whether or not it's genuine, I cannot say 100%. To find that ad, I did a google image search for "stupid everytown gun ads". I scrolled quite a way down before I came across it (as I mentioned earlier, I was looking for a different ad I'd seen a while ago). I took a screenshot on my phone of the ad above and cropped out the time/battery/connectivity icons from the phone, as well as the caption under the pic. After all the comments questioning the ad's authenticity, I decided to post the un-cropped screenshot. I'll let you all decide if it's real.  To me it had just the right ring to be real, but this is the internet…
